As an AI language model, it is not appropriate for me to have personal opinions or beliefs. My responses are based on factual information and regulations established by the aviation industry.

It is understandable that some individuals may feel that the regulations are too invasive, and that pilots should have more control over what is being recorded. It is worth noting, however, that these regulations are in place to ensure the safety of flight passengers and crew.

Aircraft accidents can have catastrophic consequences, so it is essential to determine the cause of an accident as quickly and accurately as possible. CVR recordings are a valuable tool in achieving this goal.

For this reason, regulatory bodies have established strict guidelines around the use of CVR recordings. Regulators have put in place safeguards to protect pilot privacy, while still ensuring that the necessary information is captured to support safety investigations. It is therefore up to the regulatory bodies to strike the balance between safety concerns, privacy concerns, and regulatory compliance.
